Information or research, Decision-making
Information or research, Creative projects, Entertainment
ai_safety_open_comment: I'm wary of current generative AIs particularly LLMs, with issues such as hallucination and other unpredictable errors, and risks inherent in human interaction with chatbots etc. (see e.g. the "Eliza Effect" for a classic but still relevant example predating modern AI, but the risks now are more complex and extensive than that).  I'm confident that technology will continue improving, but I'm also concerned that some types of risks could actually expand, even with efforts to mitigate risks.  I'm torn between optimistic and pessimism about the future of AI influencing essentially all aspects of human life.  I'm also concerned about other unresolved AI-related issues such as growing resource and energy usage.
ai_values_multi: Transparency, Accountability, I have a too strong an inclination to select more than 3 of the most important criteria here.  We need Accountable and Transparent and what I'd call Reliable AI, insofar as possible, and we also need to prioritize non-harm and human well-being and even environmental well-being, and we need robust Ethical Frameworks and Guardrails, etc. - ALL of these and more are going to be very important indeed.

ai_primary_use_cases: Information or research, Work tasks, Creative projects
ai_safety_open_comment: My main concern surrounding AI safety, is that I have observed both heavy religious and political bias. I fear it will be used as yet another propaganda tool and that people will walk blindly into it. AI could and should be pure and a tool for real advancement of the human race, but I fear this will not be the case. Greed and thirst for power will likely win.

ai_primary_use_cases: Information or research, Work tasks, Decision-making
ai_safety_open_comment: I think like most tools it will get better and less biased in the future but it's up to users to remain skeptical and not blindly accept results, just like most people wouldnt automatically just accept the first result on a Google search
